intro: Hetaeria taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan hetaeria, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Hetaeria taiwaniana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
